intro: Mukia scabrella, commonly known as the rough mukia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a rough, scaly texture. Mukia scabrella is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
